elements.title: Deir el-Balah sarcophagi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some of the Bronze Age Deir el-Balah sarcophagi (pictured) looted by Moshe Dayan became part of his private collection?

elements.title: Pennywise (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that movie characters like Pennywise have been cited as contributing to some people's fear of clowns?

elements.title: Willows Inn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Willows Inn, headed by chef Blaine Wetzel, was one of the restaurants that inspired the horror comedy film The Menu?

elements.title: Magic Cat Academy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the animator of the Magic Cat Academy Halloween-themed Google Doodles overcame her arachnophobia to design a spider boss that was ultimately rejected as "way too scary"?

elements.title: Cthulhu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cthulhu, Dagon, and Hydra are actually mud dragons living off the coast of Madagascar?

elements.title: Hal Hirshorn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that photographer Hal Hirshorn recreated the 1865 funeral of a wealthy Manhattanite for a 2011 photo series?

elements.title: Charlie the goat (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Charlie the goat hospitalized his co-star three times on the set of The Witch?

elements.title: All You Need Is Death (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when a prospective funder called the script for his horror film All You Need Is Death "weird and confusing", Paul Duane got the phrase tattooed on his arm and funded the film himself?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Parahyangan

The West Javanese region centred around Java's third largest city of Bandung is an excellent place to hike and admire active volcanoes.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Sekigahara

This quaint mountain town and battlefield, where Tokugawa won control of Japan, gives visitors firsthand insight into feudal Japanese warfare.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
